The development permit (DP 18-829236) is for the construction of 30 townhouse units at 7580 No. 1 Road. The rezoning of the site to the 'Medium Density Townhouse (RTM2)' zone was approved by Council on October 12, 2021. The proposed modification to the Tree Management Plan and Landscape Plan is to address the deterioration and irreversible decline of a tree (Tree Tag #726) that was supposed to be retained. The applicant agreed to plant 62 new trees on-site, including 13 conifers and 49 deciduous trees. Tree 726 has shown signs of decline since June 2022 and is in an advanced state of irreversible decline, according to the Project Arborist's findings. The City's Tree Preservation staff have reviewed and agreed with these findings.

applicant: Weaver Technical Corp.
description: Weaver Technical Corp. has applied for a Development Permit to build a barge ramp at 11191 Twigg Place. The site is currently zoned as 'Industrial (I)' and is used for truck and industrial equipment storage. The proposed barge ramp would be located within the ESA portion of the site. The owner plans to construct a barge ramp in the water lot in front of the site for transporting aggregate materials. No aggregate materials would be stored on-site. The water lot is currently leased and used for log storage. The owner has entered into a memorandum of understanding with the leaseholder and has submitted a crown land lease application to the Province for the change in water lot use. Access to the ramp would be provided via a truck staging area and a drive aisle on the site. The development would not include any additional buildings or structures beyond the barge ramp. The existing office operation in the shipping containers would remain. The site would be raised to prepare for future dike improvements and climate change effects, with lock block walls installed along the property lines. Truck traffic would access the barges via the raised surface. The proposed barge ramp facility requires approvals from multiple regulatory agencies in addition to the City of Richmond.

applicant: Lovick Scott Architects
description: Lovick Scott Architects has applied for permission to undertake exterior building renovations to the existing McDonald's restaurant located at #115 10700 Cambie Road. This includes upgrades to the on-site landscaping and the existing garbage and recycling enclosure on a site zoned 'Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)'. The proposed modifications will only be made to the McDonald's restaurant and not the neighboring commercial retail unit. The site is part of a commercial complex with other businesses and off-street parking. The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments. It complies with the Official Community Plan and the 'Auto-Oriented Commercial (CA)' zone. Due to the minor nature of the renovations, the application was not presented to the Advisory Design Panel.

address: 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road, 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road
applicant: SNC Lavalin Inc.
description: SNC Lavalin Inc., on behalf of BC Ferry Services Inc., has applied for a Development Permit for the redevelopment of the BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance Unit and future subdivision at 12700 and 12800 Rice Mill Road and 12280 and 12300 No. 5 Road. The site is being rezoned from Agricultural (AGl) and Light Industrial (IL) to BC Ferries Fleet Maintenance and Moorage (ZI 14) to allow for the upgrading of the BC Ferries FMU. The Development Permit application includes habitat compensation and mitigation measures for the designated Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas on the site. Construction of a new machine shop building and supporting uses, renovations, modifications, additions to existing buildings, addition of off-street parking, loading, and bike parking provisions, grade and elevation increases, demolition of existing buildings, and compensation and enhancements to the Environmentally Sensitive Areas and Riparian Management Areas are part of the project. The revised scope of FMU redevelopment includes retrofitting and modifying existing buildings to accommodate FMU activities. The surrounding development includes vacant lands zoned Agriculture (AGl) to the north and a model airplane park also zoned Agriculture (AGl). There is a designated Riparian Management Area associated with an existing watercourse along Rice Mill Road.

The Advisory Design Panel supports the project.

applicant: Jacky He
description: Jacky He has applied on behalf of the property owner, Ya T Wang, to develop two front-to-back duplexes at 6531 Francis Road. The site is being rezoned from 'Single Detached (RSl/E)' to 'Arterial Road Two-Unit Dwellings (RDA)' under Bylaw 10332 (RZ 19-878165). The proposed duplexes have been refined to comply with design guidelines and fit into the neighborhood. Aging-in-place features and a convertible unit have been included in all units. Landscape plans have been provided, including on-site tree planting. The proposed scheme satisfactorily addresses urban design issues and staff comments. It complies with the Official Community Plan and the 'RDA' zone.

A new Development Permit (DP 22-023105) is required for the construction of a high-rise building with approximately 81 dwelling units at 6333 Cooney Road, which is zoned as 'High Rise Apartment (ZHR8) Brighouse Village (City Centre)'. Zoning Bylaw 8500, Amendment Bylaw 8738 (RZ 09-506908), and associated Development Permit (DP 09-506909) were approved in 2012, but the development did not proceed. A new Development Permit (DP 17-791045) was issued in 2022, and due to design changes, a new Development Permit (DP 22-023105) is required.

applicant: Sandeep Mann
description: Sandeep Mann has applied for permission to develop a 60 m2 (645 ft2) coach house at 10408 Dennis Crescent on a site zoned 'Single Detached with Granny Flat or Coach House - Edgemere (REl)'. The existing single detached house on the site will be demolished, and a new single detached dwelling and coach house will be constructed. The proposed scheme addresses urban design issues and staff comments, complies with the design guidelines for coach houses in the Edgemere neighborhood, and complies with the 'Single Detached with Granny Flat or Coach House - Edgemere (REl)' zone. The coach house is located on the east portion of the property, separated from the existing single detached dwelling, and is set back 2.0 m from the south side lot line to minimize shadowing of adjacent properties. The primary pedestrian entry to the coach house is from the rear lane, with secondary pedestrian access from Dennis Crescent along the north side of the property. The proposed exterior building materials and colors of the coach house are consistent with the neighborhood, including taupe Hardie-plank siding, taupe stucco with grey trim, cedar, and black stone accents.

applicant: Kai Mikkelsen DBA: Thorson Consulting CP
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct two mixed-use residential towers above a one-storey podium with mid-block break, all over 2 levels of below grade parking with vehicular access from W 70th Av.
NE Tower - 34 storeys consists of
1st storey - Residential lobby for NE Tower, dwelling units, amenity spaces, service rooms, and 1 CRU (restaurant shell),
2nd storey - Restaurant and Retail shells, indoor amenity and Childcare facility principal entrance,
3rd storey - Dwelling units,
4th storey - Childcare facility (shell only) w/ outdoor space and dwelling units,
5th to 33rd storeys - dwelling units w/ indoor and outdoor amenity on 5th & 9th storeys (incl 2 guest suites), and
34th storey - Indoor and outdoor amenity.
SW Tower - 29 storeys consists of
1st storey - Residential lobby for SW Tower, amenity space, service rooms and bike storage,
2nd storey - Restaurant and Retail shells,
3rd to 28th storeys - Dwelling units w/ indoor & outdoor amenity on 8th storey (incl 1 guest suite), and
29th storey - Indoor & outdoor amenity.
Total number of dwelling units = 580.
Four Fire Dept response points and four separate monitoring signals:
1. 8433 Ash St (NE Tower Residential, 675 W 70 Ave and Amenity Podium)
2. 681 W 70 Av (SW Tower Residential, Bike storage, below grade parking)
3. 638 SW Marine Dr (east block CRUs & childcare facility)
4. 650 SW Marine Dr (west block CRUs)
Guest suites are considered as indoor amenity space.
All tenant space requires separate tenant improvement permits.
Patios require separate building permits.
This permit has been reviewed under the 2019 Vancouver Building By-law (#12511).
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13 requirements.
Radio Antenna System to be installed in this building.

Stage 1 - Excavation and Shoring - issued June 20, 2023 (BP in advance of DP)
Stage 2 - Foundation to L2 slab, structure only - issued October 26, 2023
Stage 3 - Full Construction - in review (DPMA not issued)

applicant: Lisa Fang DBA: Pontem Group
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a 6 storey wood frame residential building (Heather Place Building B) consisting of 87 affordable rental dwelling units and a day care unit (Group C) for 8 or less children at the 1 st floor, all over one level of underground parking, as approved under the DPMA DP-2021-00881.
Note: This 6 storey Heather Place Building B is part of a larger development approved under the DE418891. The developer decided to split the work into two Phases:
- Phase I includes only Building B
- Phase II incudes only Building C.
Building B and Building C share common entrance to underground parkade connected via a vehicle opening at the imaginary line separating Phase I and Phase II. Building B and Building C will operate under the same ownership and cannot be stratified due to shared sanitary lines and water lines between the two buildings.
Note: This is a combustible building constructed to 3.2.2.50 requirements per VBBL 2019. The childcare facility on the first floor is allowed to accommodate only 8 (eight) children in order to be considered group C major occupancy and to allow combustible construction.
Any increase of capacity of the child care would classify this facility as A-2 major occupancy, and will require the child care to be separated by a fire separation with at least a 2 hr. fire-resistance rating constructed of concrete, masonry, or encapsulated mass timber.
12-June-2023 - Full Construction Stage issued.
REVISIONS:
13-Oct-2023 - Rev#1 issued.
Changes to shoring arrangement to south wall.
01-Dec-2023 - Rev#2 issued.
Building Permit Amendment to address sanitary upsizing for the project.

applicant: Michael Van Blokland DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultant
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - This permit has been issued for site work and all below grade facilities for the proposed development:
To construct a new 21-storey mixed-use building consisting of an office tower and a pavilion,
all over 5 underground levels containing a steam plant ( SHELL) & parking garage at Levels P4 to P1, and a storage area at Level P5.
This building is provided with a 2-stage fire alarm system and a radio antenna system.
The work was split into two Phases: Phase I & Phase II. For more details refer to Code Report by LMDG.
Phase I, BP Stages issued:
08-Mar-2023 - Stage I ( E&S -Geotechnical Excavation LIMIT -3.5 M.)
21-Jul-2021 - Stage I B (E &S of north-eastern portion of site down to P5)
25-Jan-2024 - Stage 2 (foundation to grade, struct. only)
Phase I, BP Revisions issued:
Revision #1: 26-Jun-2023 - Revision to ST1; alternative anchoring approach due to site conditions
Revision#2: 11- Sep-2023 - Revision to ST1B
NOTES:
1. Levels P5- to L1 and office tower are included in this Building Permit.
2. Construction of the above grade Pavilion is permitted under the BP-2022-03603.
3. Installation of micro-piles along Expo Boulevard and plaza extension are shown on the drawings for information only. These works are permitted by Engineering, and all documents and drawings will be attached through the sub-lease and consent agreement.
4. 24/7 Monitoring of the Commercial Buildings and Steam plant will be provided; commitment letter by the owner on file.

applicant: Michael Van Blokland DBA: LMDG Building Code Consultant
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new ten-storey (10) mixed-use building operated by The Salvation Army, consisting of:
1st & 2nd Storeys – Social Service Centre w/commercial kitchen, dining rooms, clients programs & offices
(Group A-2)
3rd storey - 22 sleeping units for Women
4th storey - 100 shelter beds for Men and amenity spaces
5th storey - 34 shelter beds for Men & 27 sleeping units for Men in Community Residential Facility (CFR)
6th storey - 11 sleeping units for Men & 23 sleeping units for Men in CRF
7th storey – 37 sleeping units for Men
8th storey - 23 dwelling units transitional housing (rental, affordable)
9th storey - 23 dwelling units permanent housing (rental, affordable), and
10th storey - amenity room and outdoor patio;
all over one level of underground level with 12 parking stalls accessible via a car elevator.
NOTE: This building contains 254 sleeping units (Shelter, Supportive and Community Residential Facility) &
46 rental dwelling units.
This building is provided with a Two-stage Fire Alarm system and an Radio Antenna system.
STAGE I - Excavation, Shoring & Foundation to Grade
Issued: 19-Jan-2023
REV#1: Revised Foundation to Grade structural drawings to suite site conditions.
Issued: 03-Oct-2023
STAGE 2 (Full Permit excluding the commercial kitchen)
Issued: 11-Oct-2023
STAGE 3 - Mechanical ( Commercial Kitchen, 4 Class I cooking operations )
Issued: 29-Jan-2024

applicant: Andrew Harmsworth DBA: GHL Consultants Ltd.
description:
Certified Professional Program - New Building - To construct a new 1-storey Childcare Centre (Group A2) with 69 spaces of 4 groups – Infants (12 spaces), Toddlers (12 spaces), full-time Preschool (25 spaces) and part-time Preschool (20 spaces), public washrooms (Group F2) for users of the adjacent park, and a waste facility.
This is a CP Process Permit and the applicant is Andrew Harmsworth, P. Eng., CP.
Contrary to the Building Code Data Sheet, the geotechnical report, by Tetra Tech (File No. 704-ENG.VGEO03868-01, March 4, 2022), specifies that this project can be designed to SITE CLASS E; however, if the design parameters change then a site specific evaluation is required. Refer to Section 6.1 of the noted report.
Building to be sprinklered to NFPA 13.
This building is voluntarily LEED Gold and Passive House.
Occupant Load = Max 84 persons (Max 50 adults at any given time due to washroom capacity)
Class 3 Cooking Operation: A sign shall be posted near the range that reads “This is a Class 3 Cooking Operation, with a grease capacity alike to a single-family residence. No commercial cooking is permitted, including preparation of meals for more than a normal household on a regularly repeated basis.”
******REVIEWED UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF VBBL 2019********
STAGED CONSTRUCTION
Stage 1: Full Construction (Jan.4/23, A. Min)
Stage 1 - REVISION #1 (Feb 28/23, A.Min): Change of Civil Engineer from Wall Carter, P.Eng at WEB Engineering Ltd to Marco Cusano, P.Eng at McElhanney Ltd. effective Jan 13, 2023.
